content: / / / / / / And now the decline of America begins on a pace that will rival the fall of Rome in ancient time. We are our own worst enemy for allowing this to happen! Yep! What our enemies tried to do to us military and failed has now succeeded by economics and we pathetic fools allowed it!!! Once we were able to make many things like Television, Radios, Cars, Cameras, many different shoes and clothing. And now we hardly make ANYTHING ANYMORE! Our greed and Corp America ( now they are part of Corp World) have allowed our manufacturing capabilities ship overseas, outsource to cheap third world countries, and/or ship as many Illegal Aliens in our country to replace American/Legal Immigrant workers and called it "Jobs that Americans refuse to do"!!! NAFTIA was the biggest JOKE played on the American/Legal Immigrant workers! They called it Free Trade! What was free about it?!! How do you compete when those cheap third world countries using slaves, two cents an hour employees, or child labor and at the same time tells America you cannot export into their country!!! The Politicians, CEOs, Upper Management, and Union Bosses have fattened their piggy banks on the backs of the very workers they were supposed to help and support!! How pathetic we are to allow this to happen! Well fools (and that include myself) we will pay the price of this folly and so will our great, great Grandchildren. For when you wipe out the Middle Class you have wipe out what made America GREAT. Welcome to the Third World People Socialist Republic of UnUnited States Comrad!!! This message has been edited. Last edited by: SSGDuke53, Mon 01 June 2009 03:18 PM

Very soon the PRC will just say no and start dumping our debt and our then de-valuating currency and thus ends our hope for any recovery... If things continue, just as they are, we are still looking at hyperinflation and shortages of food, clothing and services, such as fire, police, trash removal and the loss of basic utilities such as WATER, electricity, natural gas, the delivery of home heating oil... We are on the precipice and unless immediate action to stop it is taken, we will shortly be beyond the tipping point, if we are not already and the deepening depression will make the depression of the 1930s look like a minor hiccup... IMHO... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: quote: Originally posted by athos20: Let's see, now that we will own 60 percent of GM will we all get employee pricing? Thats the best joke I've heard all day. The only vehicle from GM that I would ever consider owning would be the Corvette. I had three of them in the past but stopped driving them in 77. Been a Toyota man ever since. When Toyota starts getting greedy I'll start buying Chinese vehicles. Oh by the way, Toyota is starting to suck a little now also. Duster, We are car people and we own what our neighbors jokingly call "a fleet". One of our favorites is a Suburban with 73,000 miles on it, never a major repair, excellent mileage for its size, and one of the best vehicles we have ever owned. We traded in a '99 Tahoe with 133,000 miles for the Suburban and it was also one fine vehicle. I'm sold on GM trucks and larger SUV's. Jack

content: quote: Originally posted by SSGDuke53: / / / / / / And now the decline of America begins on a pace that will rival the fall of Rome in ancient time. We are our own worst enemy for allowing this to happen! Yep! What our enemies tried to do to us military and failed has now succeeded by economics and we pathetic fools allowed it!!! Once we were able to make many things like Television, Radios, Cars, Cameras, many different shoes and clothing. And now we hardly make ANYTHING ANYMORE! Our greed and Corp America ( now they are part of Corp World) have allowed our manufacturing capabilities ship overseas, outsource to cheap third world countries, and/or ship as many Illegal Aliens in our country to replace American/Legal Immigrant workers and called it jobs that Americans refuse to do!!! NAFTIA was the biggest JOKE played on the American/Legal Immigrant workers! They called it Free Trade! What was free about it?!! How do you compete when those cheap third world countries use slaves, two cents an hour enployees, or child labor and at the same time tells America you cannot export into their country!!! The Politicians, CEOs, Upper Management, and Union Bosses have fattened their piggy banks on the backs of the very workers they were supposed to help and support!! How pathetic we are to allow this to happen! Well fools (and that include myself) we will pay the price of this folly and so will our great, great Grandchildren. For when you wipe out the Middle Class you have wipe out what made America GREAT. Welcome to the Third World People Socialist Republic of UnUnited States Comrad!!! You tell 'em Staff Sergeant Duke!... Till the ridiculous and idiotic trade agreements that we now have, are renegotiated or negated, we will not survive economically and thus as a nation... The PRC who is the largest single carrier of our debt, has already warned us that our policy of turning on the presses without financial backing of our debt, will crush us... Very soon the PRC will just say no and start dumping our debt and our then de-valuating currency and thus ends our hope for any recovery... If things continue, just as they are, we are still looking at hyperinflation and shortages of food, clothing and services, such as fire, police, trash removal and the loss of basic utilities such as WATER, electricity, natural gas, the delivery of home heating oil... We are on the precipice and unless immediate action to stop it is taken, we will shortly be beyond the tipping point, if we are not already and the deepening depression will make the depression of the 1930s look like a minor hiccup... IMHO... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: quote: Originally posted by athos20: Let's see, now that we will own 60 percent of GM will we all get employee pricing? Thats the best joke I've heard all day. The only vehicle from GM that I would ever consider owning would be the Corvette. I had three of them in the past but stopped driving them in 77. Been a Toyota man ever since. When Toyota starts getting greedy I'll start buying Chinese vehicles. Oh by the way, Toyota is starting to suck a little now also. Duster, We are car people and we own what our neighbors jokingly call "a fleet". One of our favorites is a Suburban with 73,000 miles on it, never a major repair, excellent mileage for its size, and one of the best vehicles we have ever owned. We traded in a '99 Tahoe with 133,000 miles for the Suburban and it was also one fine vehicle. I'm sold on GM trucks and larger SUV's. Jack

We traded in a '99 Tahoe with 133,000 miles for the Suburban and it was also one fine vehicle. I'm sold on GM trucks and larger SUV's. Jack

Our greed and Corp America ( now they are part of Corp World) have allowed our manufacturing capabilities ship overseas, outsource to cheap third world countries, and/or ship as many Illegal Aliens in our country to replace American/Legal Immigrant workers and called it jobs that Americans refuse to do!!! NAFTIA was the biggest JOKE played on the American/Legal Immigrant workers! They called it Free Trade! What was free about it?!! How do you compete when those cheap third world countries use slaves, two cents an hour enployees, or child labor and at the same time tells America you cannot export into their country!!! The Politicians, CEOs, Upper Management, and Union Bosses have fattened their piggy banks on the backs of the very workers they were supposed to help and support!! How pathetic we are to allow this to happen! Well fools (and that include myself) we will pay the price of this folly and so will our great, great Grandchildren. For when you wipe out the Middle Class you have wipe out what made America GREAT. Welcome to the Third World People Socialist Republic of UnUnited States Comrad!!!
reply: I agree completely with your comments. This nation will not survive because of greed and selishnish against the country.
title: It's Official Gm Files For Bankruptcy

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: quote: Originally posted by athos20: Let's see, now that we will own 60 percent of GM will we all get employee pricing? Thats the best joke I've heard all day. The only vehicle from GM that I would ever consider owning would be the Corvette. I had three of them in the past but stopped driving them in 77. Been a Toyota man ever since. When Toyota starts getting greedy I'll start buying Chinese vehicles. Oh by the way, Toyota is starting to suck a little now also. Duster, We are car people and we own what our neighbors jokingly call "a fleet". One of our favorites is a Suburban with 73,000 miles on it, never a major repair, excellent mileage for its size, and one of the best vehicles we have ever owned. We traded in a '99 Tahoe with 133,000 miles for the Suburban and it was also one fine vehicle. I'm sold on GM trucks and larger SUV's. Jack
